intro: Sabicea trailii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre beauty, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often appearing in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
